channel.title: Who would win in a fight?
channel.description:
just getting the word of the people. who would win in a fight?
The wrestler ______________________________ this guy is an extremely good wrestler. he has gotten to the second round of state. he is very strong and fast, he does wrestling and he is a linemen. this guy has a 20lb advantage over the other guy. he has no known experience in boxing or any other standing style. ................................................. The other guy ______________________________ this guy has trained in a few fighting style listed below for a year to a year and a half : aikido grappling Brazilian jujitsu and judo : he has wrestled for a year and has wrestling conditioning and knows most of the take down techniques and how to block them. ...........................................................
so who do you think would win?

item.title: Who would win in a fight?
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:11, topic:337201”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=433608.msg3184103#msg3184103 date=1271567490]
Well did you see mayweather vs big guy (w/e his name is)
[/quote]
That was completely staged, that wrestler (I believe his name is ‘Big Show’ or something), could step on Mayweather… Floyd wouldn’t have a chance in the world. Pound for pound, Floyd would whipe the floor with him - but not in a fight.

uh thanks guys =P but for real =P
and Yz85Racer, not if the wrestler doesnt know where to hit unless he gets lucky.

It’s simple shit, 4 key areas to hit:

  1. Nose
  2. Jaw
  3. Eyes
  4. Temple
    (You could include back of the head, but in any professional fighting style you’re not allowed to strike the back of the head.) Boxing doesn’t teach you where to punch, it teaches you how to punch.

However, you have your mind set on looking at it like you were placing a bet. Ask yourself what this fight is going to do… is it going to the ground or standing up? Obviously the wrestler’s main objective is to get the opponent to the ground, however wrestling is all about power, and big powerful slams… On the ground, the one with the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu will run rings around the wrestler, especially if he has grappling knowledge combined with it. Standing up, from the styles you mentioned it really is any mans guess. Even then, I’d put my money on the 2nd fighter because of his other martial art experience.[/quote]
haha thanks and im the other guy, so i might fight this kid =P and i do have grappling experiance

Read full topic
item.source: Who would win in a fight?

MY DAD CAN BEAT YOUR DAD!!!

NO MY DAD HAS A RING THAT CAN CALL CAPTAIN PLANET

YEAH WELL MY DAD HAS A MULLET, o wait…
[/quote]
WELL MY DAD WILL BUM YOUR DAD[/quote]

AND YOUR DAD WILL LIKE IT

item.title: Who would win in a fight?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

TheBeanie:

Well did you see mayweather vs big guy (w/e his name is)

That was completely staged, that wrestler (I believe his name is ‘Big Show’ or something), could step on Mayweather… Floyd wouldn’t have a chance in the world. Pound for pound, Floyd would whipe the floor with him - but not in a fight.

[quote=“0bbyme, post:7, topic:337201”]uh thanks guys =P but for real =P
and Yz85Racer, not if the wrestler doesnt know where to hit unless he gets lucky.[/quote]
It’s simple shit, 4 key areas to hit:

  1. Nose
  2. Jaw
  3. Eyes
  4. Temple
    (You could include back of the head, but in any professional fighting style you’re not allowed to strike the back of the head.) Boxing doesn’t teach you where to punch, it teaches you how to punch.

However, you have your mind set on looking at it like you were placing a bet. Ask yourself what this fight is going to do… is it going to the ground or standing up? Obviously the wrestler’s main objective is to get the opponent to the ground, however wrestling is all about power, and big powerful slams… On the ground, the one with the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu will run rings around the wrestler, especially if he has grappling knowledge combined with it. Standing up, from the styles you mentioned it really is any mans guess. Even then, I’d put my money on the 2nd fighter because of his other martial art experience.

Read full topic
